FacilityName: Olive Branch Distribution Center, J&J SLC
ParentCompanyName: Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Drugs and Druggists' Sundries Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility and Substance Overview

The Johnson & Johnson, Sales & Logistics Company, LLC distribution center located in Olive Branch, MS distributes consumer health products for various consumer products companies that fall within the J&J Group of Consumer Companies.   The aerosol products stored and distributed primarily include the following trade names; Band-Aid Calamine Spray, Micatin, Neosporin Anti-Fungal Spray, Neutrogena Sun Block Spray and Aveeno Sun Block Spray.  These products each use various amounts (or none) of the following propellants [Butane (#106-97-8), Isobutane (#75-28-5), Methyl Ether (#115-10-6), Pentane (#109-66-0)].  

The consumer aerosol products are typically in metal containers, less than 8 ounces in size, including the product ingredients, as well as the propellants.  The individual containers are typically packaged in corrugated shippers.  The shippers are typically stacked on a pallet, on which there may be 1,000-2,000 individual containers.

The palletized loads are stored within an isolated NFPA aerosol cage with ESFR fire protection.  The Olive Branch facility warehouse is approximately 990,000ft2.  The facility warehouse is split into three buildings with a fire rated wall between each of the buildings.  In addition to the ESFR fire protection for the flammables and combustibles, there is ESFR fire protection throughout the general warehouse and in-rack, Scheme-A fire protection for flammables and combustibles.  There are 24-hour security personnel and systems monitoring the facility for a potential event.

Five Year Accident History

Over the previous five years the Olive Branch Distribution Center has experienced no accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, evacuations or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.

Worst-Case Scenario

The Worst-Case scenario was performed based on the EPA Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance.   Bas

ed on the assumption that the entire contents of a cloud explodes (quantity based on product weight of one palletized unit load of each) the calculated distance (in miles) to the one psi endpoint were all calculated to be less than 0.1mile (the worst case scenario was for Pentane, thus that is the one included in submission).  The calculated distances do not extend beyond the site property line (no offsite receptors are impacted).  

Emergency Response Program

In the event of an emergency and a potential release of flammable materials within the facility, Local Emergency Responders (Olive Branch Fire Department, Station #3) would be contacted through the use of 911; secondary contact would be made to the Mississippi Emergency Management Agency (Local Emergency Management Agency District One).   

Employees of Exel and Johnson & Johnson Sales & Logistics are trained and instructed to evacuate through the nearest exit in the event of a release, fire or other evacuation signal.  Employees are not responsible for any action required to contain a release or to extinguish a fire.   Emergency Response Plans and Procedures include a Hazardous Materials Inventory Summary.

Safety/ Risk Assessment

Johnson & Johnson, Sales & Logistics Company contracts Factory Mutual (FM) Global for Risk Assessment and underwriting.  At least annually, FM audits the facility with a team of engineers for the purpose of minimizing potential risk of catastrophic events.
